alert.note: Alert for Georgetown; Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 6:54AM EDT until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of coastal northeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Georgetown and Horry. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding as it also coincides with the incoming tide resulting in slower rainwater drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Myrtle Beach, North Myrtle Beach, Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Surfside Beach, Pawleys Island, Garden City, Murrells Inlet, Socastee, Springmaid Pier, Myrtle Beach Airport, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, Burgess, Litchfield Beach, Forestbrook, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Wampee, Cherry Grove Beach and Briarcliffe Acres. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means that localized flooding is possible near small streams, creeks, and especially poor drainage areas. Flooding is also possible at prone low-lying areas along roads, which can make driving hazardous. Stay away from flooded ditches and do not drive across any flooded roads.
